title: Is it true that sometimes actresses have to sleep with directors to get a role in a film? - Quora

response.answer_text: On occasion, some of them do. I suspect that a shocking percentage of actresses in major Hollywood films decided to take the “easy” way up and put out for producers, directors or key actors who could get them work. In fact, one young actress, who remained anonymous, submitted an article to an entertainment blog called Crazy Days And Nights. Today’s Blind Items – I Worked On A Yacht -Part One (N.B., when an actress goes “yachting,” it is typically on the Med, for extra cash, which she earns by being a prostitute in international waters.)  “But I’m too PRETTY to work at Safeway!” Here is part of what the actress had to say: Each week you never know if your job will be lost. Will the show be canceled? Will the audience hate your character and you get fired? Will you ever get another job if you do get fired? I remember on my first movie, I thought I knew everything. I had been working for a decade and breezed into work, excited about this new challenge. I think it was day 3 on the movie when I was told I had to f**k the lead actor in the movie or I would lose my job. The thing is I had known this actor for a long time. Apparently he is the one who had me cast in the movie and now was payback time. I didn’t know he cast me. I didn’t know he liked me like that. My network show I had been on just ended. I had nothing lined up but this movie and a crap movie someone talked me into doing. I needed this paycheck. I did it. I slept with the guy. I have hated him since. I have never seen anything he has done. He is a f**ker who took advantage of the situation. I had known him almost my whole life but he was willing to have me fired unless I had sex with him…. What’s worse, the prostitution rings in L.A. are so elaborate that you’d think the movies exist to support prostitution and not the other way around. Actresses who are not above screwing for money will fight for a magazine cover, because they can take the magazine cover overseas and show them to Middle-Eastern oil sheikhs and BAM!, the girls can demand a higher price…  …although some of the slags from British reality TV are apparently spending so much time selling themselves on yachts that it’s driving down the prices. Think about that during the next Cannes film festival. This is not to say that all actresses have to do this. It’s also not to exclude men who turned “gay for pay” to get a part. But I suspect that powerful men in the business know that a good movie role is bait that actresses want.Also, here is the second part of that article.Today’s Blind Items – I Worked On A Yacht – Part Two***UPDATE*** As I write this, it is Dec. 13, 2017. The names Harvey Weinstein, Matt Lauer and Kevin Spacey have now been tarnished with serious allegations of ongoing sexual harassment. This is a vindication of my cynicism, although some are issuing denials. It is not a completely universal problem, given that some powerful executives simply won’t find it tasteful to coerce talent onto the casting couch. But there are plenty of powerful people who exerted their influence to commit sexual assault with impunity. The fact that I’m not anywhere near Hollywood doesn’t mean my suspicions were frivolous. We’ll know more after the pleas are entered.
